title: Unai Emery laments missing out on Liverpool midfielder Fabinho with Arsenal
text:
Unai Emery has revealed his admiration for Liverpool midfielder Fabinho and admitted he wanted to sign him for Arsenal.

The Spaniard was an admirer of Fabinho when he was in charge of PSG and the 26-year-old played for domestic rivals Monaco.

Then when he took over at the Emirates, Fabinho's name was 'on the table' to recruit, but the Gunners missed out.

Unai Emery has spoken of his admiration for Fabinho and wanted to sign the midfielder

Emery said: 'In France, I loved Fabinho a lot. He was in Monaco and I wanted to sign him for PSG.

'When I arrived here, his name was on the table to sign him but he signed for Liverpool.'

It took time for Fabinho to bed in at Anfield after joining for £40million and Jurgen Klopp exercised plenty of patience as he transitioned to Premier League football.

The Brazilian joined Liverpool from Monaco and has developed into a key player for the Reds

Emery signed Lucas Torreira instead in the defensive midfield slot. And he wants the same kind of development for two of his new players.

'The first six months he didn't play, it was adaptation. But now he is amazing and I want the same with Dani Ceballos, with Pepe,' he continued.
description: Unai Emery has revealed his admiration for Liverpool midfielder Fabinho and admitted he wanted to sign him for Arsenal. The Gunners brought in Lucas Torreira.
